title: Thermal Expansion
intent: Exploit expansion, contraction, or elasticity effects to adapt to changing conditions without redesign.

triz_principle.name: Thermal Expansion
triz_principle.definition: Use expansion or contraction of materials or systems caused by changes in conditions.

problem_understanding.core_contradiction: We need stability, but demand, load, or scope fluctuates constantly.
problem_understanding.why_this_hurts: Fixed-size solutions either waste resources when load is low or fail when load increases.
typical_signals: over-provisioned systems most of the time

solution_logic.core_idea: Design the system to expand and contract naturally with demand.
solution_logic.key_rule: Elasticity should be inherent, not an afterthought.
solution_logic.how_it_resolves_the_contradiction: The system adapts to real conditions, maintaining efficiency and resilience across load ranges.

consulting: scope elasticity instead of fixed commitments
budget ranges instead of single numbers

use_when: load or demand is highly variable

diagnostic_questions: Where do we overpay for idle capacity?
What signals should trigger expansion or contraction?
Which parts can safely scale elastically?

example.before: System capacity is fixed for peak load and underutilized most of the time.
example.after: Services expand during peaks and contract automatically when demand drops.
